Equities usually provide returns in excess of inflation. While t-bills and other money market have been earning 3-6% in the past year  global equities have gained about 15-18% in that same time periodT-bills can be considered part of money market also  so it makes sense that they're on the lower end of the money market range as they're considered super safe
Ah yea t bill part of money market
Cut down on expenses.. Shouldnt be investing if you wanna renovate your house. Just save and place money in safe n high yield products
Tbills are temporary only.There will come a time when Tbills may drop to 2% pa for example and by then u want to take risks  the risky assets could already have flown up in price.
Like now lor  already shot up

Yeah the same logic applies to savings accounts. The 3-4% pa savings accounts we see and love now. Won’t last forever.If it drops to 2%pa what are u going to do. Always have a plan and diversified portfolio.

Hi all just to warn everyone about changing the UOB One statement date. I have changed the statement date and realise I did not receive my quarterly UOB One cashback. According to UOB  they say they have combined the statement which means that I do not have 3 consecutive statement of spending
As usual  offset next statement due for cc.

So your new month starts at Jan? Jan to Mar is your new statement quarter  with Dec spending merged into Jan.Similar to my statement change for my UOB EVOL card  they combined the 2 statement months into 1 so I lost 1 month of cashback. But the difference is you'll lose the quarter's cashback if you already hit the requirement in Dec (I'm assuming you changed your statement month because it starts in Dec).But with the new statement quarter (from Jan)  you'll still have Mar to clock before they compute your cashback also.

I changed just to make it easier to tie in with the UOB One account monthly spending. To be honest  I just lose out $50 for the quarter. But it's just not right for UOB to do that. And don't want others to get penalised by UOB

Yes. Working hard in my job. I understand investment in equity is just for long term. Just that because I am new to investment I wonder how long I have to wait only. Though I know is for retirement  human being human we will periodically look at the grow... To see if it is at a desirable rate only. ☺️
Haha it's better off doing it in the initial month of approval to prevent this from happening
